author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

This package is being registered because a PR made to LazyInitializedFields.jl (https://github.com/KristofferC/LazilyInitializedFields.jl/pull/32) wasn't reviewed. I suspect we can just get that PR merged instead of needing to create a whole new fork for this, so I'm going to leave a blocking comment, but I'll remove my block if Kristoffer won't accept your PR @loganhotz, does that sound good?

Kristoffer's bio on Github explicitly says "Message me on the JuliaLang Slack if you need something urgently. I sometimes declare "notification bankruptcy" and clean out all notifications. Keep pinging.", so I think there's a good chance he just missed your PR.

Yes that sounds great - I was hoping to work on this economics project in my own little corner, so I initially wanted to avoid bothering such a major person in the Julia community. I’ve pinged him on the JuliaLang slack.

Thank you for your help, Mason! Best,
Logan

> On Nov 10, 2023, at 5:53 PM, Mason Protter ***@***.***> wrote:
> 
> 
> This package is being registered because a PR made to LazyInitializedFields.jl (KristofferC/LazilyInitializedFields.jl#32 <https://github.com/KristofferC/LazilyInitializedFields.jl/pull/32>) wasn't reviewed. I suspect we can just get that PR merged instead of needing to create a whole new fork for this, so I'm going to leave a blocking comment, but I'll remove my block if Kristoffer won't accept your PR @loganhotz <https://github.com/loganhotz>, does that sound good?
> 
> Kristoffer's bio on Github explicitly says "Message me on the JuliaLang Slack if you need something urgently. I sometimes declare "notification bankruptcy" and clean out all notifications. Keep pinging.", so I think there's a good chance he just missed your PR.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/95144#issuecomment-1806535385>, or unsubscribe <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/APM7QHU3WFHPIKIV32OZBC3YD2V7BAVCNFSM6AAAAAA7GWRVSKVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMYTQMBWGUZTKMZYGU>.
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
>

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now. If this pull request should not be closed, please either (1) fix the AutoMerge issues and re-trigger Registrator, which will automatically update the pull request, or (2) post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. [noblock]
This pull request has been inactive for more than 30 days and has automatically been closed. Feel free to register your package or version again once you fix the AutoMerge issues. [noblock]
